text: Wallace "Wally" Wade MoonSteve Springer, "Dodgers' Moon found success in Coliseum", Los Angeles Times, March 23, 2008. (April 3, 1930 – February 9, 2018) was an American professional baseball outfielder in the Major League Baseball. Moon played his 12-year career in the major leagues for the St. Louis Cardinals (1954–58) and Los Angeles Dodgers (1959–65). He batted left- handed and threw right-handed. He was born in Bay, Arkansas. Moon died on February 9, 2018 in Bryan, Texas of skin cancer at the age of 87.Former Texas A&M; great, MLB star Wally Moon dies at 87 ==References== ==Other websites== *Retrosheet Category:1930 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from skin cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Texas Category:St. Louis Cardinals players Category:Los Angeles Dodgers players Category:Sportspeople from Arkansas Category:Sportspeople from Texas
title: Wally Moon
